page.title: 10Barnston, Lt Dunmow, Felsted
page.content:
Much of the farmland around the villages of Barnston, Little Dunmow and Felsted is used for crops, mostly barley, wheat and oilseed rape. In order to use modern mechanised methods, hedges have been removed to make larger fields. To cut down expense many of the large pieces of equipment are shared between farmers.
Some of the farms are privatly owned but others are rented from Essex County Council. This originates from the end of the first World War when a statue was decreed by Parliament that County Councils were required to make a number of farms available for ex-servicemen to rent. Many Councils are now selling these farms, but Essex is one of the exceptions and remains one of the largest landowners.
